name: Tessian
description:
At Tessian we have built our technology to empower people to work safely, without security getting in their way. We believe people shouldn’t have to be security experts to do their jobs. Our Human Layer Security platform automatically protects employees from risks like data exfiltration, accidental data loss and phishing. 

We believe people are the most important decision makers in any organisation. We’re a group of data scientists, engineers, designers, creative thinkers and commercial experts that are passionate about protecting people processing data in the enterprise. 

We’ve raised $60m from security investors Sequoia, Accel and Balderton who have helped build many industry defining companies including Stripe, Slack, Crowdstrike and Dropbox and have two office locations in both London and San Francisco. 

We would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Convert to Product Management Programme
jobs.description:
Tessian

Tessian is a SaaS technology company on a mission to keep the world's most sensitive data and systems private and secure, backed by some of world's top VCs, including Sequoia, Accel and Balderton.

With offices in London and the US, we're rapidly growing our team to meet the huge market demand for Human Layer Security. We're a diverse team of engineers, salespeople, data scientists, marketers and more focused on protecting individuals and organisations against human error through machine learning and natural language technology.

We'd love to hear from you.

Convert to Product Management Programme

At Tessian we’re offering the opportunity to transition from a number of career paths into the Product team at one of the fastest growing technology companies in the world. No prior Product Management experience is required, we’re just looking for the smartest minds who want to help us create the next major category in cybersecurity.

Tessian is building the world’s first Human Layer Security platform to automatically secure all human-digital interactions within the enterprise. Today, our products use stateful machine learning to protect people using email and to prevent threats like spear phishing, accidental data loss due to misdirected emails, data exfiltration and other non-compliant email activity. 

It can be hard to understand what Product Management is like without working in it, meaning that many of the best Product thinkers never end up getting a chance to show what they can do.

That’s why we're looking for people who could be brilliant Product Managers, but just don't know it yet. 

We think great product managers can come from anywhere, but we are particularly interested in candidates that have experience building products e.g. as a developer, designer, data scientist or founder.

Interested? Please read on...

What is Product Management like at Tessian?

The reality of the Product Manager role can vary significantly from company to company. This is especially true in Europe where the discipline is still relatively immature. We spend a lot of time at Tessian thinking about what great Product Management should be and are committed to investing in helping both experienced PMs and newcomers develop in the role over time.

Product Managers at Tessian are not ‘Project Managers’ tasked with delivering a roadmap dictated by someone else. They are also not ‘mini-CEOs’ who make all the decisions and tell everyone else what to do. Product Managers at Tessian empower engineering teams to build amazing products for our customers. They do this by setting a vision for the product, guiding team discussions to focus on impact, and helping teams intimately understand our customers problems.


Does this sounds like you?
* Strongly opinionated about great and poor products
* Frustrated with how you’ve seen products being built in the past and always thought there was a better way
* Excellent storyteller - both written and verbally

Why we think you'll love it here
* You’ll work alongside amazing, high-performing colleagues
* We offer a competitive salary and equity options with every role, with annual salary reviews.
* 25 days of paid holiday leave, plus an additional 8 days off for UK public holidays
* A full week of work-remote a year - take your laptop and work for a week a year from wherever you like!
* Plentiful breakfast options included, as well as delicious snacks, soft drinks and a top-of-the-range coffee machine
* Team lunch provided on Fridays - normally with more hummus than you can shake a stick at
* Elite membership of the Tessian House System - giving our socials (https://www.instagram.com/tessianofficial/?hl=en) a competitive edge
* High-quality tech kit provided for you to work on
* Tessian Library: if you have a work-relevant book you'd like to read, we'll buy it and add it to our library!
* Flexible working hours and working from home, subject to agreement with your line manager
* Pension plan contributions of up to 3%
* Cycle to work scheme
* Eye care vouchers for annual eye-tests
* Family friendly 1 day per week working from home guaranteed for parents and carers
* Extra day off to take a child to their first day of primary school and/or nursery
* Childcare vouchers
* If you’re coming from abroad, we’ll provide relocation assistance. Over 25% of the company is international and we’re always as supportive as we can be in helping people make the move




Equality & diversity

Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here. 

As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM, our CFO is the Chair of the WISE Campaign's Young Professionals' Board, & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups.

Important notices

Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters. Any unsolicited CVs, profiles, or names, submitted in any format, by any channel, to any of our team, will be deemed to fall outside any terms and/or conditions with either the person submitting the information or their company of employment/representation.

By submitting your application to Tessian, you consent to Tessian retaining your information and contacting you about future job opportunities, that may be of interest, for up to 2 years in accordance with our Privacy Policy

Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.

jobs.title: Head of Legal & Compliance
jobs.description:
Tessian
We believe technology should secure the digital interactions of employees without compromising user experience or productivity. That’s why we’re building the world’s first Human Layer Security platform. 

We’re a team of mathematicians, data scientists & engineers building breakthrough machine learning and natural language technologies to analyse, understand & protect enterprise email networks.

Tessian is backed by leading technology investors Sequoia Capital and Accel who have helped build many industry defining companies including Stripe, Slack, Crowdstrike and Dropbox.

We'd love to hear from you.

Legal at Tessian 

We’re looking for a Head of Legal & Compliance to join us at Tessian!
 
Legal at Tessian is fundamental to our growth, and to our value to Do The Right Thing. Tessian is at an exciting stage in our journey & this role will involve a varied and interesting workload, including commercial negotiations, IP, working with the engineering team on new features, data protection, maintaining our cap table, & advising on employment and general commercial law matters. This role will also gradually take over Data Protection Officer duties.
 
As our Head of Legal & Compliance, you’ll be critical to enabling our teams, from Product to Sales. You’ll be a creative thinker that will build scalable processes, and find opportunities to pre-empt and overcome frictions.You’ll report to our CFO, and will act as one of our functional heads sitting within our Operations team. 
 
Every day is different in Legal! You'll be a motivated and detail oriented individual, ready and willing to get involved in all areas of the business and its ever changing projects. You'll be excited to be our sole Legal adviser until we embark on our next significant stage of growth, and you'll have a mind for streamlining & scale to keep company operations running smoothly.
 
As a commercially minded, diligent individual, you'll have a great opportunity to help shape Legal and Compliance at Tessian, particularly with the new and exciting challenges we have ahead.


As our Head of Legal & Compliance, you'll get to:
- Define our legal strategy
- Draft, review and negotiate a broad range of agreements, contracts and other legal documentation (including - but by no means limited to - commercial contracts, non-disclosure agreements, & marketing agreements), with a view to commerciality & scale
- Respond to legal requests from all areas of the business
- Communicate and advise on legal concepts
- Develop in house standard templates and policies
- Create streamlined legal processes
- Work closely and advising internal stakeholders on risk-related matters
- Liaise with external counsel, where applicable, on projects from fundraising to IP to employment law
- Become our Data Protection Officer & handle internal data protection queries & requests


We'd love to meet someone who:
- Has significant post qualification experience, a passion for legal functions in-house
- Has a specific interest in technology &/ startups (enterprise SaaS is a plus!)
- Is passionate about enabling teams
- Embodies our [values](https://www.tessian.com/careers/) and is excited to work the *Tessian* way
- Has excellent attention to detail…
- …but loves breaking down bureaucratic frictions
- Is comfortable working autonomously in a fast paced environment
- Loves the idea of being our Legal island in our Operations archipelago
- Possesses very strong organisational skills, is proactive, inquisitive & creative
- Ideally has some experience with Intellectual Property experience and Data Protection - if you do, please do tell us about this in the 'Additional Information' section


Why we think you'll love it here
- It’s important to us that all Tessians are part of the journey we’re on, so we offer **equity options with every role** and benchmark to provide **above market rate salaries** - there’s plenty more too….
  
**Be at your best, both inside and outside of work** - A full week of work-remote a year, in addition to 25 days of paid holiday
- Flexible working hours and working from home
- Curate your career with development experiences uniquely suited to you
- We’re family friendly, with policies built to support you in all stages of life
- High-quality tech kit provided for you to work on including Tessian ANC headphones
- If you're relocating to join the team, we'll provide a contribution to help with your costs
  
**Because everyone loves food...** - A plethora of breakfast options, delicious snacks, drinks and a top-of-the-range coffee machine
- Team lunch provided on Fridays - normally with more hummus than you can shake a stick at
- Dinner budget for those times you just can’t tear yourself away
  
**Beyond work** - Elite membership of the Tessian House System...
- On Fridays we stop at 5 and share team updates and drinks
- Monthly team socials & a big, whole team extravaganza every quarter
- Never-ending ping-pong tournaments





Equality & diversity

Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here. 

As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups.

Important notices

Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters. Any unsolicited CVs, profiles, or names, submitted in any format, by any channel, to any of our team, will be deemed to fall outside any terms and/or conditions with either the person submitting the information or their company of employment/representation.

By submitting your application to Tessian, you consent to Tessian retaining your information and contacting you about future job opportunities, that may be of interest, for up to 2 years in accordance with our Privacy Policy

Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.

jobs.title: IT Manager
jobs.description:
Tessian
We believe technology should secure the digital interactions of employees without compromising user experience or productivity. That’s why we’re building the world’s first Human Layer Security platform. 

We’re a team of mathematicians, data scientists & engineers building breakthrough machine learning and natural language technologies to analyse, understand & protect enterprise email networks.

Tessian is backed by leading technology investors Sequoia Capital and Accel who have helped build many industry defining companies including Stripe, Slack, Crowdstrike and Dropbox.

We'd love to hear from you.

IT at Tessian

We’re looking for an IT Manager to help us keep IT at Tessian driving forward. 

This is a unique opportunity to refine, and implement our IT stack.

You’ll report to our CFO & be comfortable exploring and implementing new technical solutions to manage our rapidly growing IT estate. At Tessian our priority will always be security, but we’re looking for someone with the instinct to walk the fine line between security and usability. We seek to empower our employees to achieve excellence, and we believe a powerful IT function is a key asset in our ability to do so.


Our current state of the union:
- c 140 UK staff (demised UK office) and c 20 staff in San Francisco (shared or serviced offices)
- Computing: Mac (75%) Linux (15%) and Windows (10%)
- Telephony & AV: iPhones & Zoom
- Predominantly cloud-based: GSuite, AWS, Spoke ticketing, & cloud-based MDMs & password managers


The role involves:
- Designing and deploying IDS, firewall and patch management systems
- Building out our VPN infrastructure to allow secure access for our employees
- Implementing pragmatic & solid IT and Information Security best practices, and monitoring and overseeing their implementation
- Managing our IT estate & ensuring delivery of service desk responsibilities
- Owning IT audits
- IT training & on-boarding
- Working with Sales & Customer Success to answer customer security queries
- Liaising with our Platform/DevOps team to ensure secure good production hygiene


Why we believe this role is so exciting:
- Fast paced environment, with fast scale, iteration and implementation
- Full support from the business and your colleagues
- Challenge of maintaining parity across Mac, Linux and Windows


We'd love to meet someone who:
- Has 5+ years experience as an IT manager.
- Is comfortable (or willing to get comfortable) working across Mac, Linux and Windows.
- Ideally has some scripting skills
- Ideally has some AWS skills


Why we think you'll love it here:
- You’ll work alongside amazing, high-performing colleagues
- We offer a competitive salary and equity options with every role, with annual salary reviews. 
- Everyone gets 25 days of paid annual leave (33 days including bank holidays)
- Company contributions are made towards your pension
- Class pass subsidy
- You’ll get a high quality MacOS tech kit to work on
- One week of remote working from abroad per year
- We have regular communal company lunches, and [regular team socials and activities](https://www.instagram.com/tessianofficial/)
- Fully stocked kitchen with plenty of office snacks including fruit, nuts, bread, cereals, and amazing coffee
- We offer a cycle to work scheme, & eye-care vouchers.
- Parents and carers are guaranteed one day per week of work-from-home, and we'll give you an extra day of annual leave to take your child to their first day of nursery and primary school.
- If you’re coming from abroad, we’ll provide relocation assistance. Over 25% of the company is international and we’re always as supportive as we can be in helping people make the move


Equality & diversity

Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here. 

As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups.

Important notices

Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters. Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.

We'd love to hear from you.

Product Marketing Management at Tessian

As Product Marketing Manager, you will drive go-to-market activities for major product releases and service offerings for Tessian. You will partner with Product Management, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to understand the needs of our customers, guide the creation of relevant sales and marketing assets and shape messaging. You have a growth mindset and enjoy taking a hands-on approach to everything you do.


In this role you'll get to:
- Build a deep knowledge of our market, customers and competitors
- Guide product roadmap and strategyDrive product naming, messaging and positioning through research
- Define pricing strategies and position the product within the market
- Create customer and pipeline reviews to understand the customer value
- Measure the success of our product and evaluate the key performance indicators
- Coordinate with sales leadership and executive management to define sales support initiatives
- Create content to drive sales and advance deals (i.e.: case studies, competitive information factsheets and product collateral)
- Partner with Product Managers to train and educate our sales team and customer success team


We'd love to meet someone who:
- Has 5+ years of experience in B2B marketing with a strong track record of success - having led game-changing initiatives
- Thinks differently and knows when to follow a playbook that’s served them well and when to innovate and create something completely new
- Has strong proven leadership skills and highly developed interpersonal skills to lead, manage and inspire a diverse and global team
- Loves to spend time analyzing the data, looking for trends and ‘aha!’ moments
- Has TedTalk-like communication skills - we’re an increasingly globally dispersed team and need to stay connected


Why we think you'll love it here:
- You’ll work alongside amazing, high-performing colleagues, and have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of starting up a new office of a fast-growth, Sequoia-&-Accel-backed technology company
- Great startup culture
- We offer a competitive salary and equity options with every role, with annual salary reviews
- Generous PTO policies
- Flexible working hours and work from home policies including flexibility for parents and caregivers 
- We offer three tiers of plans, with the lowest tier of Aetna health insurance 100% paid for by Tessian (no employee contribution required), with a $0 in-network deductible.
- 401K Company Match: 100% of first 1% and 50% of next 5%
- You’ll get a high quality MacOS tech kit to work on including laptop, phone and peripheral accessories
- One week of remote working from abroad per year
- Monthly fitness subsidy of $60 towards ClassPass
- If you’re coming from far away, we’ll provide relocation assistance. Over 25% of the global company is international and we are always as supportive as we can be in helping people make the move. Please note however that **we are unable to sponsor US visas**.


Equality & diversity

Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here. 

As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups.

Important notices

Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters. Any unsolicited CVs, profiles, or names, submitted in any format, by any channel, to any of our team, will be deemed to fall outside any terms and/or conditions with either the person submitting the information or their company of employment/representation.

By submitting your application to Tessian, you consent to Tessian retaining your information and contacting you about future job opportunities, that may be of interest, for up to 2 years in accordance with our Privacy Policy

Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.
